questions.question_text:
While troubleshooting the failure of an OSPFv3 Ethernet connection between routers R1 and R2, you determine that the hello timers are mismatched and that R2 is configured with default settings.
Which command do you enter on R1 to correct the problem?

discussion.content: The 'no ipv6 ospf hello-interval' and 'no ipv6 ospf dead-interval' are ways to return to the default values. So answer is D.

A. R1(config-if)#ipv6 ospf hello-interval 20 - WRONG, because 20 is not default
B. R1(config-if)#ip ospf hello-interval 10 WRONG because "ip"=OSPFv2, not OSPFv3
C. R1(config-if)#ip ospf hello-interval 20 WRONG (see A and B)
D. R1(config-if)#no ipv6 ospf hello-interval CORRECT.
Don't overthink the answer is B without a doubt

R1#sh run interface serial 1/0
Building configuration...

Current configuration : 193 bytes
!
interface Serial1/0
 description To_R2
 no ip address
 ip ospf hello-interval 15
 ipv6 address 2001:DB8:1:12::1/64
 ipv6 ospf 1 area 10
 ospfv3 hello-interval 15
 serial restart-delay 0
end

R1#sh ipv6 os
R1#sh ipv6 ospf ne
R1#sh ipv6 ospf neighbor 
R1#sh ipv6 ospf int s1/0

 Last flood scan length is 1, maximum is 1
 Last flood scan time is 0 msec, maximum is 0 msec
 Neighbor Count is 0, Adjacent neighbor count is 0 
 Suppress hello for 0 neighbor(s)
R1#

R1#sh run interface serial 1/0
Building configuration...

end

R1#

R1(config-if)#
R1(config-if)#do sh ipv6 ospf ne
R1(config-if)#do sh ipv6 ospf ne

Neighbor ID Pri State Dead Time Interface ID Interface
2.2.2.2 0 FULL/ - 00:00:22 7 Serial1/0
R1(config-if)#
R1(config-if)#do sh ip
*Nov 21 13:30:42.287: %OSPFv3-5-ADJCHG: Process 1, Nbr 2.2.2.2 on Serial1/0 from FULL to DOWN, Neighbor Down: Dead timer expired
R1(config-if)#do sh ipv6 ospf ne
R1(config-if)#ipv6 ospf hello-interval 10
R1(config-if)#
*Nov 21 13:31:55.575: %OSPFv3-5-ADJCHG: Process 1, Nbr 2.2.2.2 on Serial1/0 from LOADING to FULL, Loading Done
R1(config-if)#do sh ipv6 ospf ne

Neighbor ID Pri State Dead Time Interface ID Interface
2.2.2.2 0 FULL/ - 00:00:35 7 Serial1/0
R1(config-if)#
And the request it is for ospfv3, so you cannot implement the command ip ospf hello-interval 10, it should be ipv6 ospf. So definitely the answer its D.
It is ambiguous because D is too the correct answer....

comments.content: Correct--The No will restore the default Value

discussion.content: Answer is D. #no ipv6 ospf hello-interval will set the R1 hello-interval to default like R2.

questions.question_text: Which BGP command do you enter to allow a device to exchange IPv6 prefixes with its neighbor?
Which protocol is incompatible with CGMP leave processing?

discussion.content: CGMP is mutually exclusive with HSRPv1. You cannot enable CGMP leaving processing and HSRPv1 at the same time. However, you can enable CGMP and HSRPv2 at the same time. Cisco Group Management Protocol or CGMP-server support is provided on the switch; no client-side functionality is provided. https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/lan/catalyst3750x_3560x/software/release/15-2_2_e/multicast/configuration_guide/b_mc_1522e_3750x_3560x_cg/b_ipmc_3750x_3560x_chapter_01001.pdf

questions.question_text: In which two ways can you isolate the location of a connectivity issue between two devices on your network? (Choose two.)

choices.E: Execute a traceroute from the source to the destination to locate the problematic hop. CE
choices.B: Send an extended ping from the destination to the source.
choices.C: Execute a traceroute from the destination and work toward the source to locate the problematic hop.
choices.A: Test whether the next hop from the source can reach the destination and work toward the destination.
choices.D: Send an extended ping from the source to the destination.

discussion.content: C and E , run a tracert from both ends to islolate the LOCATION of failure...
The answers should be D and E.

choices.C: The switch with the highest root ID is elected as the root bridge.
choices.A: Each VLAN must have a separate root bridge.
choices.D: Dynamic root bridge assignment is most efficient.
choices.B: An individual switch can be the root bridge for only one VLAN.

questions.question_text: Which statement about STP root bridges is true?

discussion.content: Also, only PVST can allow VLAN's to have a different root bridge. The question only mentions STP. There is a similar, possibly exact question, with an answer that auto root bridge was best.
A can't be right. Several VLANs can have the same root bridge.
